subject: Business
title: Fiat Currency: Money by Government Decree
description: A 60-second lesson on Fiat Currency: Money by Government Decree.

hook.text: A dollar bill costs 12 cents to print. Its face value is $1. The difference is pure government authority.

buildup.text: Fiat money has value because the government declares it legal tender â€” not because it's backed by gold or silver.

discovery.text: Every major currency today is fiat. The US dollar, euro, yen, and pound are all backed by institutional trust.

twist.text: Fiat gives governments flexibility to manage economies. It also gives them the power to debase currencies.

climax.text: No fiat currency has survived forever. The average lifespan of a fiat currency is 27 years.

punchline.text: Your money is worth something because everyone agrees it is. For now.

quiz.question: What gives fiat currency its value?
options: The gold stored in central bank vaults
The paper and ink it's printed on
